meanings.definition: To assign too much work or responsibility to (someone)
meanings.sent1: The teacher should not overtaske the students with too many assignments.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overtaske herself by taking on too many projects at once.
meanings.sent3: It would be comical to overtaske a snail with running a marathon.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule was so full, it felt like she was overtasked with juggling flaming torches.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the world seemed to overtask his shoulders as he struggled to keep up.

meanings.definition: To burden with excessive demands or tasks
meanings.sent1: The manager didn't want to overtask his employees with unrealistic goals.
meanings.sent2: Being a perfectionist can often lead to overtasking oneself with unattainable standards.
meanings.sent3: It would be amusing to overtask a cat with guarding a fishbowl.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing inbox overtasked her like a mountain of paperwork ready to topple.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending to-do list seemed to overtask her mind, leaving her feeling overwhelmed.
